text.0: may powers auspicious come to us from every side never deceived unhindered and victorious.
text.1: that the gods ever may be with us for our gain our guardians day by day unceasing in their care.
text.2: may the auspicious favour of the gods be ours on us descend the bounty of the righteous gods.
text.3: the friendship of the gods have we devoutly sought so may the gods extend our life that we may live.
text.4: we call them hither with a hymn of olden time bhaga the friendly dakṣa mitra aditi.
text.5: aryaman varuṇa soma the aśvins may sarasvatī auspicious grant felicity.
text.6: may the wind waft to us that pleasant medicine may earth our mother give it and our father heaven.
text.7: and the joygiving stones that press the somas juice aśvins may ye for whom our spirits long hear this.
text.8: him we invoke for aid who reigns supreme the lord of all that stands or moves inspirer of the soul.
text.9: that pūṣan may promote the increase of our wealth our keeper and our guard infallible for our good.
text.10: illustrious far and wide may indra prosper us may pūṣan prosper us the master of all wealth.
text.11: may tārkṣya with uninjured fellies prosper us bṛhaspati vouchsafe to us prosperity.
text.12: the maruts sons of pṛśni borne by spotted steeds moving in glory oft visiting holy rites.
text.13: sages whose tongue is agni brilliant as the sunhither let all the gods for our protection come.
text.14: gods may we with our ears listen to what is good and with our eyes see what is good ye holy ones.
text.15: with limbs and bodies firm may we extolling you attain the term of life appointed by the gods.
text.16: a hundred autumns stand before us o ye gods within whose space ye bring our bodies to decay.
text.17: within whose space our sons become fathers in turn break ye not in the midst our course of fleeting life.
text.18: aditi is the heaven aditi is midair aditi is the mother and the sire and son.
text.19: aditi is all gods aditi fiveclassed men aditi all that hath been born and shall be born.
